content.description: Start in the rotten dihedral before moving left to gain the prominent layback feature up the face. Technical terrain leads to a tricky crux reaching the large undercling feature at the top.
content.location: It is on the right side of the Last Turn Crag.

content.description: This is a route with cool moves, but it has some of the worst rock I've encountered in the Poudre. It will be much better once it cleans up more.
content.location: This is the leftmost route at the crag, aim for a left-facing dihedral near the top.

content.description: This is a good route once you get past the first two bolts, which is awful choss. After clipping the second bolt, you launch into a very cool boulder problem where some foot trickery allows you to lock off on some small crimps. Once you get on the black streak, the holds are amazing, and the climbing is easy until one more crux around the last bolt and a wild move to finish. Insanely sandbagged at 11b, I suspect holds have broken. It felt more mid to upper 5.12 to me.
content.protection: Five bolts, the anchors are off to the left. If you are toproping, it would be good to extend the anchors, because otherwise the rope runs over a ledge.
content.location: This goes up the center of the wall, up the black streak.
